scenarioDescription:
The HD 212771 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 212771 is a star with 1.56 times the mass of the Sun, and 5.27 times its radius. It is located 362.54 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 212771 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 212771 system


HD 212771 b

HD 212771 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2010-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 212771 b is 760.020 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 212771 b is 13.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 212771 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 212771, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 212771 - System With 1 Exoplanet
